name: AI-Powered Clinical Assistant for Doctors
description: SaaS tool for doctors to record, summarize, and manage patient interactions.

current_prd.elevator_pitch: For doctors seeking to streamline patient interactions, our SaaS tool offers secure call recording, AI-powered summaries, and comprehensive patient record management, enhancing efficiency and accuracy in clinical practice.
current_prd.problem_statement: Doctors struggle with manual note-taking during patient calls, leading to incomplete records, administrative burden, and potential for errors in patient care. Existing solutions lack integrated AI for efficient summarization and secure, centralized patient management.
current_prd.solution: Our SaaS tool provides a secure platform for doctors to record patient calls, automatically generate AI-powered clinical summaries, and manage comprehensive patient records. This streamlines documentation, reduces administrative overhead, and improves accuracy in patient care.

key_features.feature_description: Doctors can securely record patient conversations and store audio files within the platform.
Automatically generates transcripts and GPT-powered clinical summaries for each recorded call.
Allows doctors to create, view, and manage patient profiles, visit history, and call logs in a centralized system.
Ensures only authenticated physicians and authorized staff can view or manage patient records, adhering to privacy regulations.

steps: Doctor initiates a call within the platform or uses a compatible recording device.
System securely records the audio of the patient conversation.
Audio file is stored in the patient's record.
System initiates transcription and summarization process.
Recorded audio is sent to transcription service.
Transcription service converts audio to text.
Text transcript is sent to GPT model.
GPT model generates a clinical summary.
Summary is attached to the patient's call log and record.
Doctor logs into the platform.
Doctor navigates to the patient records section.
Doctor searches for a specific patient.
Doctor views patient profile, visit history, and call logs.
Doctor can edit patient information or add new entries.
Doctor can access recorded calls and AI summaries.
Admin logs into the platform.
Admin navigates to the user management section.
Admin creates new user accounts for physicians and staff.
Admin assigns roles and permissions (e.g., physician, nurse, receptionist).
Admin can revoke or modify user access.
System enforces role-based access control for patient data.

current_prd.success_metrics: Increased efficiency in documentation (e.g., 30% reduction in time spent on notes), improved accuracy of patient records (e.g., 95% accuracy in AI summaries), high user adoption rate (e.g., 70% of target users actively using the platform within 6 months), positive feedback from doctors on ease of use and value.
current_prd.competitors: Existing EHR/EMR systems (e.g., Epic, Cerner) which may offer some recording/note-taking features, dedicated medical transcription services, general-purpose AI note-taking tools (e.g., Otter.ai, but not HIPAA compliant or clinically focused), other specialized medical dictation software.
current_prd.vision: To become the leading AI-powered clinical assistant, revolutionizing how doctors manage patient interactions and records, enabling more efficient, accurate, and personalized healthcare delivery globally.

target_audience.name: Doctors
target_audience.pain_points: Time-consuming manual note-taking, risk of incomplete or inaccurate records, administrative overhead, difficulty recalling specific patient details from past conversations.
target_audience.demographics: General practitioners, specialists, and other medical professionals in private practices or clinics.
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Efficient patient record keeping, accurate clinical documentation, reduced administrative burden, improved patient care, secure data management.

phasing.rationale: This phase includes all core features necessary to demonstrate the complete value proposition: secure call recording, automatic AI summarization, and centralized patient record management with essential security. This makes the product both demo-able to stakeholders and potentially launch-able to early adopters for initial feedback, as it addresses the primary problem statement.

current_prd.design_principles:
Efficiency: Streamline clinical workflows and reduce administrative burden for doctors.
Accuracy: Ensure precise transcription, reliable AI summaries, and accurate patient record keeping.
Security & Privacy: Implement robust security measures and adhere to healthcare data privacy regulations (e.g., HIPAA).
Usability: Provide an intuitive and easy-to-navigate interface for medical professionals of all tech proficiencies.
Accessibility: Design for diverse user needs, ensuring the platform is usable by all doctors and staff.

user_personas.name: Dr. Anya Sharma, General Practitioner
user_personas.goals: Efficiently record patient consultations, quickly review patient history and summaries, reduce time spent on administrative tasks, ensure accurate and comprehensive patient records.
user_personas.pain_points: Manual note-taking is time-consuming and prone to errors, difficulty recalling specific details from past conversations, administrative burden detracts from patient care, concerns about data security and compliance.
user_personas.preferred_device: Desktop for record management, Mobile for on-the-go access and call recording.

user_personas.name: Maria Rodriguez, Medical Assistant
user_personas.goals: Efficiently manage patient appointments and records, assist doctors with administrative tasks, ensure smooth patient flow, maintain data accuracy and confidentiality.
user_personas.pain_points: Tedious manual data entry, difficulty coordinating information across different systems, time-consuming record retrieval, ensuring compliance with privacy regulations.
user_personas.preferred_device: Desktop for daily tasks, Tablet for patient check-ins.

steps.description: Initiates a call with a patient using the platform's integrated call feature.
Securely records the audio of the patient conversation.
Automatically processes the audio, generates a transcript, and creates an AI-powered clinical summary.
Receives a notification that the summary is ready and reviews it, making any necessary edits.
Stores the audio recording, transcript, and summary securely within the patient's record.
Confirms the summary and files it with the patient's visit history.

user_journeys.context: Dr. Anya Sharma needs to record a patient consultation and have it summarized.
user_journeys.trigger: A scheduled patient phone consultation begins.

steps.description: Uses the search bar to find the specific patient.
Clicks on the 'Edit' button for contact information.
Updates the phone number and email address.
Confirms the update and displays the revised patient profile.

user_journeys.context: Maria Rodriguez needs to update a patient's contact information.
user_journeys.trigger: A patient calls to update their contact details.

current_prd.navigation_design:
Primary Navigation: A persistent left-hand sidebar for main sections (Dashboard, Patients, Calls, Settings, Help & Support). This ensures quick access to core functionalities.
Patient Section Navigation: Within the 'Patients' section, a tabbed interface or sub-navigation links for 'Patient List', 'Patient Profile', and 'New Patient' will allow for easy switching between patient-related views.
Call Section Navigation: Similar to the patient section, 'Calls' will have sub-navigation or filters for 'Call List' and 'Call Details'.
Contextual Navigation: Breadcrumbs will be used to indicate the user's current location within deeper sections, especially within 'Patient Profile' and 'Call Details', allowing for easy backtracking.
Search Functionality: A prominent search bar will be available across the platform, particularly in 'Patients' and 'Calls' sections, to quickly find specific patients or call records.
Access Control Integration: Navigation elements will dynamically adjust based on user roles and permissions, ensuring only authorized users see relevant options (e.g., 'User Management' under 'Settings' will only be visible to administrators).

class Doctor < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :organization
  has_many :patients, dependent: :destroy
  has_many :call_recordings, dependent: :destroy

  validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
  validates :password_hash, presence: true
  validates :name, presence: true

  rhino_owner :organization
  rhino_references [:organization]
end
